chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Chad A Cooper not in court, in custody.  Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs in court for Chad A Cooper.  Attorney Stephan Eduard Nolten in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a Scheduling Conference.  
Court waived appearance. Defense request a final pretrial and jury trial dates.
State will keep offer for 2 weeks. 
Court ordered parties to file their Pretrial documents 48 hours in advance of the final pretrial hearing.
Case remains calendared in Branch 19.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Nathan Opland dobs appaears in court. Defendant Chad A Cooper not in court, in custody. 
Stephan Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Scheduling Conference. 
Defense in receipt of discovery and offer from the State and request time to review with the defendant. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Chad A Cooper in court by video with Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs who appears in person.  Defendant Chad A Cooper in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Whitefish Bay Detective J. McLeod. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.  
*Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Chad A Cooper not in court, defendant in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney.  Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Meghan B., Miriam D., Judith F., Katsiaryna H., Pakouda M.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.
  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Chad A Cooper in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Chad A Cooper in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
